Package goosegame

Class Board

java.lang.Object
goosegame.Board
Direct Known Subclasses:
ClassicalBoard
public abstract class Board extends Object
Represents the game board in the goose game. This is an abstract class that serves as a blueprint for specific board implementations. It defines the common structure and behavior of game boards, including the total number of cells, an array of cells, and methods for initializing the board.

    • GooseCell

      protected List<Integer> GooseCell
      Represents a list of positions for Goose cells on the game board. These positions are used during the initialization of the game board to create instances of GooseCell.

  • Constructor Details

    • Board

      public Board(int nbOfCells)
      Constructs a new Board with the specified number of cells.
      Parameters:
      nbOfCells - The number of cells on the board.

  • Method Details

    • initBoard

      protected abstract void initBoard()
      Initializes the board by creating instances of the Cell class for each cell. This method is meant to be implemented by subclasses to customize the board initialization.

    • getCell

      public Cell getCell(int index)
      Gets the cell at the specified index on the board.
      Parameters:
      index - The index representing the position of the cell on the board.
      Returns:
      The Cell at the specified index.

    • getNbCells

      public int getNbCells()
      Gets the total number of cells on the board.
      Returns:
      The total number of cells on the board.
